item.title: Why Do Parrots (And People) Eat Clay?
item.description: September 7, 2017 - Several species of parrots in Southeastern Peru regularly gather at a cliff face in the Amazon basin to eat clay. So do other animals, including humans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - Several species of parrots in Southeastern Peru regularly gather at a cliff face in the Amazon basin to eat clay. So do other animals, including humans. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/07/547981850/why-do-parrots-and-people-eat-clay

item.title: Here's What You Need To Know About Hurricane Irma
item.description:
September 6, 2017 - As the powerful storm approaches the U.S., here are some of the basics about the dangers it poses.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/06/548891942/here-s-what-you-need-to-know-about-hurricane-irma
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Climate, Power, Money And Sorrow: Lessons Of Hurricane Harvey
item.description: September 6, 2017 - Through the power of Katrina, Sandy and, now, Harvey, we get a view into how a changing climate may play out in the real world — beyond arguments and abstractions, says astrophysicist Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 6, 2017 - Through the power of Katrina, Sandy and, now, Harvey, we get a view into how a changing climate may play out in the real world — beyond arguments and abstractions, says astrophysicist Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/09/06/548658019/climate-power-money-and-sorrow-lessons-of-hurricane-harvey

item.title: Western Wildfires Endanger Beloved Sites At National Parks
item.description: September 5, 2017 - A 20-square-mile blaze burned the historic Sperry Chalet in Glacier National Park last week. In California's Sierra National Forest, an ancient grove of sequoias was scorched, but the trees survived.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - A 20-square-mile blaze burned the historic Sperry Chalet in Glacier National Park last week. In California's Sierra National Forest, an ancient grove of sequoias was scorched, but the trees survived. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/05/548648114/western-wildfires-endanger-beloved-sites-at-national-parks

item.title: In A Case That Is 'Almost Impossible,' Girl Dies Of Malaria In Italy
item.description: September 5, 2017 - "It's a mystery," said one health official. Italy was declared malaria-free in 1970. Officials will try to determine how and where the 4-year-old was infected.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - "It's a mystery," said one health official. Italy was declared malaria-free in 1970. Officials will try to determine how and where the 4-year-old was infected. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/05/548624097/in-a-case-that-is-almost-impossible-girl-dies-of-malaria-in-italy

item.title: The Army, The Inventor And The Surprising Uses Of A Batman Machine
item.description: September 5, 2017 - The Army wanted a new, small device that could pull a person rapidly up a rope. The invention they eventually got has uses far beyond the military.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - The Army wanted a new, small device that could pull a person rapidly up a rope. The invention they eventually got has uses far beyond the military. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/05/545481011/the-army-the-inventor-and-the-surprising-uses-of-a-batman-machine

item.title: In Texas, Concerns About Damage To Flooded Toxic Waste Sites
item.description: September 4, 2017 - Environmental officials are inspecting toxic waste sites in southeast Texas that were flooded and potentially damaged last week.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - Environmental officials are inspecting toxic waste sites in southeast Texas that were flooded and potentially damaged last week. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/04/548490643/in-texas-concerns-about-damage-to-flooded-toxic-waste-sites

item.title: So You Want To Buy An Electric Car? It Requires Some Planning
item.description: September 4, 2017 - With new models aimed at the mass market going on sale this fall, Americans will hear a lot more about electric cars. Here's what you should know if you're on the market for one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - With new models aimed at the mass market going on sale this fall, Americans will hear a lot more about electric cars. Here's what you should know if you're on the market for one. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/04/545593956/so-you-want-to-buy-an-electric-car-it-requires-some-planning

item.title: Trump Picks Oklahoma Congressman To Head NASA
item.description: September 4, 2017 - Rep. Jim Bridenstine is a fighter pilot who wants Americans to return to the moon but doesn't believe that humans are causing climate change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - Rep. Jim Bridenstine is a fighter pilot who wants Americans to return to the moon but doesn't believe that humans are causing climate change. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/04/548472775/trump-picks-oklahoma-congressman-to-head-nasa

item.title: Trump's Nominee To Be USDA's Chief Scientist Is Not A Scientist
item.description: September 4, 2017 - Sam Clovis has a doctorate in public administration, is skeptical that humans have a role in climate change and pushed theories suggesting former President Barack Obama was born in Kenya.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - Sam Clovis has a doctorate in public administration, is skeptical that humans have a role in climate change and pushed theories suggesting former President Barack Obama was born in Kenya. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/04/547934012/trumps-nominee-to-be-usdas-chief-scientist-is-not-a-scientist

item.title: Get Off The Couch Baby Boomers, Or You May Not Be Able To Later
item.description: September 4, 2017 - If you sit too much during middle age — at work and at home — your ability to exercise or even walk in late decades is at risk, a study hints. And, of course, your risk of heart disease climbs, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - If you sit too much during middle age — at work and at home — your ability to exercise or even walk in late decades is at risk, a study hints. And, of course, your risk of heart disease climbs, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/04/547580952/get-off-the-couch-baby-boomers-or-you-may-not-be-able-to-later

item.title: Coca-Cola Offers A Sweet Quest: A Million Bucks To Replace Sugar
item.description: September 4, 2017 - The company is holding a contest to find a new and natural, low-calorie sweetener. The challenge comes at a time when many Americans are cutting back on sugar due to obesity and diabetes risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - The company is holding a contest to find a new and natural, low-calorie sweetener. The challenge comes at a time when many Americans are cutting back on sugar due to obesity and diabetes risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/04/547315191/coca-cola-offers-a-sweet-quest-a-million-bucks-to-replace-sugar

item.title: Fall Weather Headed Your Way? Time For Flu Shots
item.description: September 4, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics reminds us that shots — not a nasal spray — are the most effective way to protect kids 6 months and older against the flu.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics reminds us that shots — not a nasal spray — are the most effective way to protect kids 6 months and older against the flu. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/04/547916216/fall-weather-headed-your-way-time-for-flu-shots

item.title: 'American Space Ninja' Back On Earth After Record-Breaking Flight
item.description: September 3, 2017 - Peggy Whitson smashed multiple records after spending a total of 665 days in orbit over the course of her career.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - Peggy Whitson smashed multiple records after spending a total of 665 days in orbit over the course of her career. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/03/548295156/-american-space-ninja-peggy-whitson-back-on-earth-after-record-breaking-flight

item.title: The Bumblebee Hunter
item.description:
September 3, 2017 - The Franklin bumblebee is so small and hard to track that it's not clear if it's gone extinct. We tag along as one man makes his annual trek to try to find it.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/09/03/548255852/the-bumblebee-hunter
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
